text: Carlo Glasbergen (born May 16, 1990 in Benthuizen) is a Dutch curler from Zoetermeer and curls out of the CC PWA Zoetermeer. He has curled in 5 European Curling Championships. He also played lead for Jaap van Dorp at the 2017 World Men's Curling Championship, where they finished in 11th place. Glasbergen also won the Collie Campbell Memorial Award in 2017 at the World Championships. ==Personal life== In 2017, Glasbergen worked as a data analyst for Vitality Management.2017 Ford Worlds Media Guide: Team Netherlands ==Teammates== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Event ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Result |- ! scope="row"| 2017 WCC | Jaap van Dorp || Wouter Gösgens || Laurens Hoekman || Carlo Glasbergen || Alexander Magan || 11th (1–10) |- ! scope="row"| 2018 WCC | Jaap van Dorp || Wouter Gösgens || Laurens Hoekman || Carlo Glasbergen || Alexander Magan || 10th (4–8) |- ! scope="row"| 2019 WCC | Wouter Gösgens (fourth) || Jaap van Dorp (skip) || Laurens Hoekman || Carlo Glasbergen || Alexander Magan || 10th (4–8) |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Dutch male curlers Category:Living people Category:1990 births Category:People from Zoetermeer Category:Sportspeople from Alphen aan den Rijn
